citation.article-title: Donghicola xiamenensis sp. nov., a marine bacterium isolated from seawater of the Taiwan Strait in China.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Donghicola xiamenensis sp. nov.
Donghicola xiamenensis (xi.a.men.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. xiamenensis pertaining to Xiamen).
Cells are Gram-negative, ovoid rods (1.0–2.0 μm in length and 0.5–1.2 μm in width), non-spore-forming and lack flagella.
Colonies are beige, smooth, opaque, circular and convex with entire margins and 2.0–2.5 mm in diameter after 3 days cultivation at 28 °C on HLB.
Cells do not contain bacteriochlorophyll a.
Grows at temperatures ranging from 18 to 37 °C.
Optimal growth occurs at 25 °C and at around pH 7.0.
No growth occurs in the absence of NaCl or in the presence of >12 % NaCl.
Optimum concentration of NaCl for growth is 1–3 % (w/v).
Tween 80 is hydrolysed, but gelatin, starch and arginine are not.

Among the 95 carbon sources in the Biolog GN2 system, positive reactions were observed for glycogen, l-arabinose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid monomethyl ester, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, dl-lactic acid, propionic acid, succinic acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinamic acid, l-alaninamide, glycyl l-glutamic acid, l-histidine, l-proline, l-phenylalanine, l-pyroglutamic acid, urocanic acid, phenyethylamine and 2,3-butanediol.

Susceptible to doxycycline, ofloxacin, ciprofloxacin, chloramphenicol, tetracycline, norfloxacin, erythromycin, minocycline, gentamicin, neomycin, polymyxin B, cefalexin IV, amikacin, cephradin, midecamycin, kanamycin, fortum, cefuroxime, cefazolin and ceftriaxone.
Major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C18 : 0 and C16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 62.4 mol%.
The type strain, Y-2T (=MCCC 1A00107T=LMG 24574T=CGMCC 1.7081T), was isolated from seawater collected near Haitian Dock of Xiamen island at the west bank of the Taiwan Strait, China, in 2004.
